page.title: 08Glue sniffing in Beverley
page.content: One of the worrying trends in Beverley at present is the increase in glue sniffing. Some young people put glue into plastic bags and then sniff the fumes. A campaign has been launched to stop glue sniffing. The Social Services Neighbourhood team manager,Ms.Audrey Orr said that the glue sniffing youngsters who came to her notice were aged about 13 years. As they grew older, they usually grew out of the habit. A letter has been sent to every shopkeeper who sells glue, telling them to put fake glue on their shelves. If anybody steals it they will find an empty packet. The shopkeepers will keep the real glue under the counter. In this way it is hoped that the habit will eventually be cured.
